title: Graduate Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward and well technical. Had a panel discussion and discussed my role with the hiring manager. I recommend anyone with past experience to apply for this opportunity
Interview Questions: Past experience working with content migration

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in May 2023
Interview Descriptions: The hiring managers and staff in charge of the interview offered quick responses to any questions I had before and after the interview process. The interview process was very informative as well as very welcoming so I did not once feel unsure of what I was getting into.
Interview Questions: Am I willing to relocate?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty smooth. Basic questions like Tell me about yourself, interests, etc. Dress professionally always or at least look presentable. 1-2 interviewers asking questions, decreases the intimidation and anxiety.
Interview Questions: How would your friends describe you as?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Expectations were clearly set beforehand. Although it was an incredibly hectic day, I felt very welcomed by the entirety of the faulty and staff. Overall, I was very impressed with this institution.
Interview Questions: What prompted your interest in UT-Arlington? How can you contribute to the university's culture? What is your preferred pedagogical approach?

title: Accountant II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Roughly a one hour phone call with 4 other people who are in the department. Standard questions about previous work and experience. Also questions about how conflicts have been handled and what the most complicated thing I've done in Excel has been.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a conflict and how you resolved it in your current position.

title: Content Creator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: If you take the Digital Studies class at UTA there is no interview process. You are admitted, but you must do a recorded pitch and also a quiz to figure out your strengths and weaknesses to decide what group you will be placed in.
Interview Questions: Q: What are your skills? Q: What experience do you have?

title: Others Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: It was great, makes you feel welcome. The communication was great and they would active listen to you. I enjoyed speaking with the panel. I would not mind speaking to them again.
Interview Questions: What are the 3 things you would do once you are hired?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straightforward and did the interview process did not take too long. I was asked to do some excel work which was not very difficult. I heard back after a few days.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have related to this job?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: 3-ish person committee, same questions for everyone, 30 minutes in total really need to know what they want and from you be sure to prepare questions for them what support you will need Zoom collaboration opportunities etc
Interview Questions: what support do you need for your research?

title: PLTL Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: One short interview with the program coordinator which was a behavioral type only interview. The interview lasted about 25 minutes where we talked about why I applied for the job and what I expect to get out of it. The interviewer also clarified some expectations and cleared up questions at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview offer after 1 month of applying and the interview was all behavioral. The interviewer was super nice. She walked through the role and description of the job and the work environment too. Just be prepared with behavioral questions and you will do it for sure!
Interview Questions: Q: What challenging projects you did in the past? Q: How do you deal with stress?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions:
Tell me something about yourself.
How did you hear about this position?
Why do you want to work here?
Why did you decide to apply for this position?
What is your greatest strength?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
What do you know about this company/organization?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and received a call within a few days. The first round was a phone interview with a few supervisors in the department. The asked basic questions. They were polite and professional. Gave me a decent estimate of when they would let us know about the 2nd round.
Interview Questions: What would a previous supervisor say about you?

title: Health Educator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions:
- Asks questions related to health promotion and public health
- Knowledge of drug and substance use
- Knowledge about college communities
- Asks questions and then present on a health topic
Interview Questions: What is your background in health promotion and health education?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: After the application, there was initial phone interview. After the phone interview, there was in person interview and lab visit followed the interview. the inperson interview was taken by the direct supervisior.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and how yuo fit the role.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions:
Offers are based on academic merit and given to current PhD students. As such, no interviews.  Academic merit to meet includes GRE scores, TOEFL, and GPA minimums. 

The role is also continuous per the duration of your Ph.D.
Interview Questions: No question was asked as disclosed earlier.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: Mostly everyone was very nice, could tell they were all extremely busy, though obviously they can't help that. Good school, respectful staff, nice environment, good location, likely good future possibilities and advancement
Interview Questions: What are your long-term goals

title: Peer Academic Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: Apply using handshake, and take the classes needed before a semester. If no classes taken, you will be taught for 2 days. The interview is pretty easy where you will be asked about times and the challenges and stuffs like that.
Interview Questions: SMART questions, usually basic .

title: GTA Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: On the basis of skills, the questions are asked. Along with that they check your GPA and your knowledge about the subject. The process is pretty chill, you should have enough knowledge about the subject.
Interview Questions: Questions based on the subject

title: Communications Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: There were 6 people on the call, one person was in her backyard. It is a nonprofit but they required more of an education experience. I did not get any communication after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join UTA?

title: Associate Director of Development for Annual Giving Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process took about 2 months total from start to finish, which isn't completely unusual for universities. I started with a 45 minute screening phone call, which was very conversational and delightful. About a month later is when I was called in to interview on-site; this is where it got challenging. The interview process was about 5 hours long with one bathroom break. It was incredible meeting so many team members, but the questions were very repetitive and the process was extremely draining to keep up with no break for food. I did a virtual 45 minute video call a few days later with another staff member that could not be in attendance.

 I ended up not getting the job based off of experience qualifications that I thought were clearly vetted in the screening phone call. No harm no foul not getting the job, I just wish they had vetted that process better before using their staff time and my time. Overall I spent about 6.5 hours in interviews with UTA.
Interview Questions: What should worry me about your resume?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: The process was long and annoying. It looked like they did not know what they were looking for.  Coming from another country I was confused by the whole procedure. Not the best memories.
Interview Questions: What was your educational background?

title: Technical Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the University job platform for students. After a week or so of waiting, I received an email asking to call to schedule an in-person interview.  They worked with my class schedule to set the interview. They offered me the job on the spot after the interview and said they'll send all the documentation via email.  Started within a week or so.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why do you want to work with us? 
Q: Are you open to increase in responsibilities?

title: PMO Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Asked questions regarding work ethic, problem solving, etc and had unique exercise at the end. Approachable and didn't feel as pressured as other interviews, casual and inviting atmosphere. Made me feel respected and acknowledged
Interview Questions: How would you handle a coworker that was behaving rudely?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in May 2021
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and received a brief phone call with simple screening questions within a few days of applying.
Met with multiple supervisors with average to difficult questions -after interview talked about salary and start dates etc.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted this job?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: No interview, ask the chair of TA. You have to be at good standing, GPA 3.3/4 at least. They will prioritize the PhD student before giving it to master student. Not quite sure the policies
Interview Questions: No interview, just need to be at good academic standing

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was technically oriented and most of the questions were based on the job role and the resume submitted. Linux and web development were the major requirement with the passion and desire to commit to the assigned work.
Interview Questions: Linux and web development were the major requirement with the passion and desire to commit to the assigned work.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: As a student worker, the process was fairly easy.  After applying through SnapJob, the manager of the position will email you to schedule an in-person interview. You should hear back soon afterwards about the result.
Interview Questions: How will you deal with a customer that demands a refund?

title: Web Developer/Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions:
3-week process. 
First week: 3-person panel interview with the director of the department, manager, and a full-time technical employee over Microsoft Teams. 
Second week: Document review.
Third week: Received an offer.
Interview Questions:
What do you want to do with your degree?
What do you think about UT Arlington's current online brand?

title: Software Developer Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview was fairly good. It consisted behavioral questions with some coding questions to test whether you are good at coding or not. The interviewee were very humble and were listening to the answers positively.
Interview Questions:
1. Questions related to my projects.
2. Introduce youself

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Very chill. The people who interviewed me were very nice. They tried to find common ground on things that we would talk about.  They value culture who they work with so they can fit in and have good relations with everyone
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: It was a completely behavioral interview with basic management questions.  Questions are more related to customer relations. The interviewers were very friendly and kind. I guess it was about 3 people who  took my interview.
Interview Questions: How would you handle stress?

title: CAD Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions:
It was a very formal and Easy interview.
most of the questions were from my resume and past experiences. it lasted about thirty minutes and got my result immediately. pay is also good compared to other on-campus jobs.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself?
What are your Expectations?

title: Software Engineer(Internship) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Hacker rank assessment on c++, This was the first step and I could not get past this step. They care a lot about c++. Im a ML student looking for internship.
Interview Questions:
About c++, conceptual questions in form of multiple choice questions.
Then 2 algorithm questions:
The second one was the coin change problem, and the first one was more about reading a file and doing some analysis.
All done in c+

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed and super friendly, was able to comfortably talk as an incoming freshman. I was asked a few questions concerning if I had been at the library before (which doesnt matter) and questions about what I was studying for
Interview Questions:
What was your major?

Have you been to the library?

title: Peer Academic Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: Panel interview with two supervisors. They went back and forth and it was more of a conversation of my experience as a student and what has helped me while being in undergrad.
Interview Questions: What is one campus resource used that helped with one of your classes?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: No interview process, GTAs are chosen by professors/departmental staff based on an application process.  Submit an application to the department you wish to GTA for with and then wait until candidates are selected, which can be up to 3 weeks after the semester starts.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions from Resume and basic behavioral questions. Describe about the projects. Your favorite class. Your strength and weaknesses. What technologies did you use on the projects. How did you learned it?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (New York, NY) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very slow process. They ghost applicants. Lots of politics keep out qualified candidates. They have criticle positions listed from 8 months ago. How do you go without a critical position for that long?
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX)
Interview Descriptions: the professor found my resume and emailed me directly, asking me if I want to join his group. I said Yes. Then he asked me what was my research topic and my research experience
Interview Questions: what is your research focus

title: Gas Tank Inspector Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Simple. Phone interview followed by a in-person interview. Process took a while since funding is a little slow. I had applied in November and did hear back from them til March and I started in May.
Interview Questions: basic questions. nothing technical. More behavioral questions

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds, drop application resume, get shortlisted, appear for an interview and wait for the acceptance. Selectors are kind-hearted. So be open and honest. Let them know you need the job and follow up on intervals but do not bug them by spamming
Interview Questions: How do you handle unwanted situation

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Interview process : writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates, and making a hire. First 6 month is for the try-out. If you can impress, you will get long-term employment.
Interview Questions: What made you think you are the best candidate for this position ?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: I have applied in-person at the accounting department, I then received a call for an interview. It was very easy, they just want to know the person. Few days later I received another call saying I got the job
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was good. Not so easy, not so tough. Went and talked to the professor and explained my interest and accomplishments and sent him an email to accept me as hi TA. Department - CSE.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Admissions Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Went through 4 rounds, very rushed, and they were not helpful when trying to get some answers on institution policies. I felt like I was just another candidate, despite being offered the job. They did not keep me in the loop very well
Interview Questions: Typical questions. They didn’t seem very tailored to each person

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Smooth. Sent an email directly to me. Asked for my major and my interests. Then responded back with the decision within a week. Started the position a week later. The office environment was very quiet and allowed me to work to my potential.
Interview Questions: Why this job?

title: General Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: For the process in interviewing, it seemed like a straightforward process and it was streamlined.  It helps to keep in mind that as a university, things moved a bit slow and it takes a while on a few matters but overall it was okay.  It was a pretty painless procedure.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions: as well as strength and weaknesses.

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Casual, simple questions. About yourself, your interest and why you want this position and how much time will you be able to invest into the job. 

Describe a time when you gave someone an advice on a tough situation
Interview Questions: How would you help other residents in the hall

title: Student Worker OIIR Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on snapjobs and was called into for interview a few weeks later. Met with two of the student managers from and was asked only a few questions. Felt mainly like a meet and greet.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Coordinator III, Risk & Compliance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Irving, TX) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions: First interview was a phone interview.  It was discussed that the salary would be in the $60K-$65K range.  The interview was very pleasant.  The 2nd round of interview was to write essays to 12 questions.    Pay was way too low for the hurdles that had to be jumped in the interview process.
Interview Questions: What was a time when you helped a client overcome a risk?

title: International Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions:
They were/are still  honestly the most unprofessional company I have ever interviewed for. The process was fairly basic with me applying online and then about 3 weeks later I was scheduled for a group phone interview.  It was a fairly generic phone panel interview and they seemed to like my answers. 

After completing that process they emailed me a week later informing me they would like me to come visit them in person. I would be required to purchase my flight there (I flew from Orlando) but they would cover my food and lodging. I agreed and flew out two weeks later. They failed to remember to pick me up from the airport so I was required to take an Uber and never gave me anything in regards to covering my meals. The only thing that was set up was my lodging at a hotel nearby. 

They picked me up late from the hotel on the day of my interview and told me that they would reimburse me for my Uber and food expenses as long as I emailed them receipts. After that they took me around campus and I met with a panel of people from the department.  While I was there they asked me several questions which I felt were unprofessional but I was willing to answer. Several of them pertained to me being religious and how that would affect me working the position and if working previously at a religious organization would affect my work. 

After the interview they informed me they would follow up with me within the next two weeks, right before Christmas, with their decision. I was told it was down to me and a few other people. December 31st rolled around and I had not heard back from them nor been reimbursed for my expenses. I emailed them early January, around the 7th, asking them if they had made any decisions yet about the position. I have still not been informed of the decision to pick someone else nor have I been reimbursed for my expenses that they assured me they would cover.  

I am truly happy that I did not get that position because I would not want to work for an organization that treats their employees in this matter. I do realize the University as a whole may not be like that, but the people in that department are.
Interview Questions: Do you think you being a Christian will cause any conflicts of interest in your role here?

title: Math Clinic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Emailed to extend their interest for an interview and then scheduled a 2-1 interview. It was very simple, not difficult.  Emailed their offer a few weeks later and then accepted their offer.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student asked you to do their homework?

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was not too complex it was simple and easy. For the most part they asked basic questions like time management skills so forth. If your honest and yourself you should be good.
Interview Questions: Time management skills

title: Several Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (New York, NY) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I have applied for three staff positions and they are still posted after 4 months with no contact to me as an applicant. How can you post a job in May and still have it posted in October?
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Analytics Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through their portal. Its very difficult to find their job postings simply through google search. 
Being an alumnus of the very university, I thought I'd be given a consideration at the least, however the hiring team (University Analytics in particular) is highly non-responsive.

When I sent them a few of my projects which were directly related to the job applied for, the head of the department replied saying 'Stop spamming me and my teammates'

This is highly unprofessional and downright disrespectful.  They do not respond to follow-ups as well. They told me to contact HR for update and when I did, the HR directed me back to the department. Very poorly managed. They are going to lose out on the best candidates Till date, I have not heard back from them.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Event Personnel Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Was a reference for a student position.  Was only asked one question the entire interview while he talked for the rest of the interview.  Mostly just explained the job and asked if I wanted it.  Gave me a handshake and told me what to do to get the papers so I could work.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview contact person provided very complete info about directions and free parking options, and the group interview was very congenial. I had a lot of transferable skills to offer, but I think they were keen to find someone with specific experience.
Interview Questions: Mostly about specific skill sets and software familiarity.

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Not so difficult questions. in general about work ethics, how much you know excel, word. typing speed. why do you want to work here? one round and that's it, you will receive an email.
Interview Questions: how comfortable are you with MS excel?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions:
Easy process
Just applied online and submitted through online with recommendations letter .
Easy process.Good University .
Good facilities 
Good accommodations 
Good research
Good weather in texas 
Good Reputation 
Good On campus Opportunity
Good  Diversity
Good Funding
Good Sports Balance
Good On campus Activities throughout year 
Good Study Abroad Programs
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Well, I got the reply in a month of application and I was gladly called for a simple interview. Came to know about the position through a friend and I immediately submitted my application
Interview Questions: How do you think the skills are relevant to the position you're applying?

title: Student Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very good and relaxed. It did not make me feel much pressure at all, and I was just asked simple questions that were about myself and school-things like that.
Interview Questions: What is your major? Why do you want to work here?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The expectations of the program were clearly specified and therefore interview was conducted accordingly. I was asked about my background and how I would be beneficial to the program. Questions were then asked to test my knowledge about the subject and to determine if I was a suitable candidate for the position.
Interview Questions: What was one experience where you helped someone through something?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and executive assistant handles the interview and communication skills is the only area they focus on interview as resume filtering takes care of the rest. Confidence is important attribute they look for in the interview process. Being flexible also helps
Interview Questions: Describe your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Housing Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: There were two people who were asking question about the job position and behavioral interview questions. The guy was the marketing coordinator and the lady was the supervisor of the office.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with rude customers?

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It was like a casual conversation wherein I had to speak about  myself and explain my skill set. I was shown the responsibilities of a TA. The interview lasted for about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; Why should we hire you

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Group of managers, very kind, professional people.  Open discussion forum, lasted 45 minutes. The group asked many questions, asked how I felt about certain situations and roles.  They were very informative as to what they desired, and what the position meant.
Interview Questions: What is my goal for this position?

title: Spatial and Data Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Dallas, TX) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with at least five people. It took 35 mins to finish and they asked a lot questions about GIS workshop. The interview was hard because I wasn't familiar with GIS and I think they might need someone has geography background instead of library science.
Interview Questions: What is the definition of GIS? What will you do for the GIS workshop?

title: Finance Literacy Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: I met with the dean finance professor in his office and discussed how the job would be like. He explained to me how dedicated and motivated I needed to be in order to excel in the job and how much work there was needed to be done.
Interview Questions: How many hours can you work?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initially, there was a phone interview. On the phone, they asked about what are your current and future plans. They asked if you know about the job description and what skills and experience you have with respect to the job. Once you clear this phone interview, the next round includes group panel interview. Usually there are 4 candidates along with you and they ask you personality related questions and finally you get the offer letter if success.
Interview Questions: Name one movie you hate and then convince me to watch it

title: Helpdesk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was a group event. We all sat down at a table and worked as a team on a puzzle. Prior to the group interview we had submitted answers to a series of questions, such as how do you deal with keeping things confidential. I was not selected to go further, but the next step would have been a panel interview and then an interview with the CIO.
Interview Questions: We solved a puzzle as a group

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: You apply via SnapJobs and if your application gets pulled, that office will reach out to you for an interview. Interviews are standard, dress business casual. You'll usually interview with an admin or director, depending on the office.
Interview Questions: Are you able to maintain office confidentiality?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Applied through their student employment portal-SNAP Jobs, was invited for an interview. About 5 people in the room asked me questions about experience, work ethic, why I wanted the job etc.
Interview Questions: 1) Why I wanted this job?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: First everyone is needed to fill in online application which has basic questions about your involvement on campus and other general things. Then comes the main two stage face to face interview. Each of around 20 minutes. During this time the basic job needs are explained.
Interview Questions: How would you build a community

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on university's website.  Got call with in just 4 days. Next week was interview.  Got hired. CBC check, new hire  paper work, pre-meetings, scheduled for work.
Interview Questions: Skills, Personality, Eligibility, Experience questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly staff, great hiring process, quick to respond. great questions asked during the hiring process, explain about the job and duties. Very open to questions. Great work life balance
Interview Questions: My skills

title: Natural Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Austin, TX) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: This position was a contract position with TCEQ through UTA. First Interview was with UTA hiring manager who asked simple questions related to the position. There was a second interview with the TCEQ manager that I was to work with.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Membership Services Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Easy, casual I didn't feel pressured, easy going supervisor. Business casual and you'll be just fine. Show up on time , don't have them waiting. Asked questions about leaders roles in my past
Interview Questions: What makes you a great fit for Campus rec

title: Transcript Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quick and to the point. It took longer to actually get a call to get the interview than it did to be offered the position after it took place. Overall, everything was great. The people I interviewed with were very personable and friendly.
Interview Questions: Standard HR questions that were prewritten.

title: SI Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Dallas, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly interviewer. Asked mostly behavioral questions. No questions about the technical aspects of the tutored course. Questions were open ended and mostly wanted to see how a student leader would react in a particular situation.
Interview Questions: What is your desired super power?

title: On-Campus Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The Department Head contacted me for an interview. The staff was friendly and welcoming but it looked like they already had someone in mind before calling the candidates for the interview. My interview went pretty well but probably someone else was hired just because his or her friend referred him or her.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, What are your strengths, Describe a failure

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. All phd students in my department automatically get graduate teaching assistant. They also get a Stem scholarship which reduces fees. Can’t think of anything more but Glassdoor needs 30 words
Interview Questions: Statement of purpose

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Usually with a professor with whom you will work. Received an email with a few questions to answer. After answering the questions on the email, I was asked to come for an interview. It was with the Hiring Manager Ashton and the professor with whom I would be working later on.
Interview Questions: They asked me to explain all the skills and projects on my resume

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place in two rounds of half an hour each. The questions were basic and simple like why do you want to be an RA? Why should we hire you? A RD and an RA ask the questions one after one and each of them note down your responses. After half and hour you are taken to another room where the same process is carried on once again. The results are notified via email.
Interview Questions:
If two roommates are having a fight over a certain issue how will you act in that situation
?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Need to approach professor with available position in there research laboratory. By putting an email, they will reply back with response for position available. Set up an interview base on suitable time.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join our research team?

title: Transcript Evaluator I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: A couple of weeks after applying online, I received a brisk (maybe 30 seconds long) phone call from HR asking if I could come in the next week at X specific time for an interview. I agreed to come in and was interviewed by two of the individuals that would be my superiors had I gotten the position. They were quite friendly. The interview was very short, sweet, and to the point, as they were only allowed to ask a specific set of questions required by the school. Expect a couple of weeks to hear back.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview with department chair of civil department at University of Texas at Arlington and asking about the availabilty weekdays and office hours and all the application was reviewed by full professors
Interview Questions: Asking very technical questions

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: It is a two step interview process: phone interview followed by a group panel interview.  The group panel will score you based on a rating for each question topic.
Interview Questions: Provide an example of a time you encountered an issue with a difficult coworker.  How did you handle the situation?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: applied online on snap job approx. three weeks ago and then got interview call from hiring manager of the department in few weeks. Scheduled an interview in a week and got an offer in a next week. Interview process was easy and quick in my case.
Interview Questions: Short and simple interview. Couple of questions about past experience in a grocery store, money handling experience and extra curriculum activity where I was a team player.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied on snap jobs created by UT Arlington then call for the interview by the manager of student accounts office.One interview round with manager and assistant director of office. Was asked all behavioral questions related to customer services.
Interview Questions: Basic question on resume

title: Public Safety Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was rather extensive. But that is a given for a Police Department as well as a state university. But they remained professional throughout the process so that was a plus.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to become a Public Safety Officer?

title: GTA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was conducted by UTA College of Business INSY department by an administrative assistant. Questions were mostly behavioral and easy. However, everything depends on your previous academic performance.

PS: your TOEFL speaking score should be more than 23+ to get selected for this role.
Interview Questions: How will you make change if we select you?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: A simple interview. It took 20 minutes. The interviewer is very friendly. First, she introduced her background and herself so that I was not nervous. Second, I answered some basic questions about my resume. Third, I had to answer 3 scenario  questions. For example, what would you do if students have problems of using computers/software/printers.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work at here?
Tell me about yourself.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was long and arduous, but in the end it went very smoothly. It was a round table meeting, very informal with all of the staff there. In the end though, it was just mostly about my major, my vision for my future, and how I would fit into the department.
Interview Questions: What was your thesis over?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was for 60+ mins. Only the professor was there on the panel. Questions were based on the Under Graduate subjects. Questions were also on the projects you worked. It will purely be on the technical stream you are applying to
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past project experiences?

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Got a call  and interview was setup for the next week in person, since it was college position. Manager took the interview in campus only. Once the interview was done, got an offer letter in week and started working in 15 days.
Interview Questions: Basic question about hardware and software, knowledge about troubleshooting and installation of software and hardware, not anything specific.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: It was simple as pie. Applied, interviewed, got the job on the spot. Most of the interview questions were regarding my school schedule and how long I was going to be attending the university.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult questions, honestly.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial Resume and application to be submitted well before the deadline and the process to review the resume and application which includes the GRE and TOEFL scores for international students takes about 3 months and a final list of candidates is listed and are presented with positions
Interview Questions: Selection is based on the merit and profile.

title: Science Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was called to schedule an interview. A week later, I showed up and was interviewed.  I was told that I got the job after interviewing and was called to training.
Interview Questions: What is your major? What do you plan on doing after college?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: was a very good experience and learnt a lot about the work culture and got the skills to adapt and develop myself to challenging world ahead of me and take pride in anything that i pursue in the future. Take responsibility in the actions taken and manage the time and resources as available.
Interview Questions: Define success

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I met the person in charge, Debbie Maxey, and told her i desperately need this job. She already knew my face, so she finally agreed. She didn't ask me too many questions, just asked if I will work for at least one year. I said yes and she offered me the job. She also said i can look for internships in summer, but if I decide to leave, I should inform her at least a month ago. And she will not stop me anyway.
Interview Questions: are you enrolled full time?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Dallas, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Very slow process unless its been directly referred.
Just need to know in general what responsibilities  you will be taking care of.
Lot of applicants for the same position.
Good communication skills required.
Interview Questions: Ready to work night shift?

title: Event Usher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Not very difficult, just applied through a job fair and got a phone and 1:1 interview. Interview wasn't too tough. They just asking what my previous experiences were. It was very simple and sweet.
Interview Questions: Not really that difficult. It was a very basic positon.

title: Comm Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Resume, References, Letter of Interest Requested; Interview scheduled one month later; Group/Panel interview; E-mailed thank you letter to interviewers; Contacted for second interview with head of department; Notified of decision the following month;
Interview Questions: Experience with FAR clause

title: Office Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the SnapJobs system they use for on campus student jobs. I received a phone call from the position supervisor and scheduled an interview. The interview was with the supervisor - an administrative assistant, and two other administrative assistants from neighboring offices. A few days after the interview I received a call offering me the position and the pay rate.
Interview Questions: What customer service skills do you have?

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Office is a typical college environment. I didnt get to see the call center when i was interviewed. Interviewer was nice and asked team based questions. Was under the impression that the job was more laid back than it actually is.
Interview Questions: Explain a time you've dealt with a difficult customer.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: Behavioural questions  were the only ones that were asked. Your skills are gauged. They may ask easy auestions but they know if you are answering correctly or not.suit up when you go for interview
Interview Questions: Team play and how to manage difficult situations

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Online application is required which is followed by the submission of resume to the appropriate professor. If the resume impress the professor, he would give a project to complete within a timeline. After the successful evaluation of the project, one-on-one interview would be called. This would be the final phase before selection.
Interview Questions: what kind of element type is used in FEA

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: I approached one of the professors to help out in his lab to gain some relevant work experience and was provided a chance to do so. He asked me what I would be most comfortable working with and then explained the details of his project along with possible roles for me in his Lab.
Interview Questions: Name

title: Customer Service Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews and a new hire orientation. It was a pretty quick process. It did begin with an initial phone interview. There was a lot of paper work to fill out because of it being a university.
Interview Questions: What are some things that you could change about yourself.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just went through my CV and asked me basic questions about  the history of my work and my progression through graduate school,  some questions were directly related to my research.
Interview Questions: "Tell me about this paper" , "Describe this research project to me" Some were first author papers, some were second author papers. Additionally, how I applied some of the skills listed in my skills and experience section in projects.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions:
Approached professor and handed resume. 30 minute interview.
The professor was difficult to find as most professors are, but once he met me he was very courteous and discussed my research options for a long time.
Interview Questions: How will you work with no prior experience in research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Professor will check your skills and education and based on that he will appoint based on the previous grades, he will estimate your caliber. He will ask some basics questions in civil engineering to know about us.
Interview Questions: education, major

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very simple, I asked a teacher to participate with his research, he gave me some books to review then we talked about it. It was very easy and a friendly conversation
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Approached by professor for GRA position based on my work experience and class performance. Also asked if I have had web development, android, and MySQL DB experience. I was also asked on what kind of projects I worked on and what was the approach to solve any given problem. It was a really nice experience for me.
Interview Questions: Would you be okay working on a web development project?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group interview, and after personal interview. During the group interview had to play different games and do different tasks in team. The main point is not to win, but to show that you are able to listen to people around, and eager to build relationship with people. RAs judge, so they do not like people who love to show off.
Interview Questions: How do you handle studying and working? What would you do to make students&amp;amp;#039; experience more interesting in residents halls?

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and about three weeks to a month later was called for a phone interview. I was intereviewed by a panel of employees who worked in the library. The questions were typical, things like "What are your best and worst qualities?", "How did you handle a difficult customer?" or "How did you strive to succeed in your previous job?"
Interview Questions: The questions were not so hard but I found it difficult to talk to the panel because I wasn't eye to eye with them. My mistake was focusing on a single panelist as opposed to everyone.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied to UTA through the website, and kept sending emails to the professors. My advisor contacted me after having my application package. She took my skype nterview, and recommended me to the department.
Interview Questions: Why did I choose UTA

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Contacting Professor is the best to get an offer, Interview process usually takes 2 weeks. based upon the position and research the pay can be from $0 to $1500/month.
Interview Questions: Describe your weakness

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I didn't have to interview, I knew my hiring supervisor as a former professor.  My previous work showed my skill and competency which led me to a direct hire without a formal interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: I made contact with my current supervisor via email. I completed my undergraduate and was looking to pursue higher study in United States in the field of my interest. I checked out potential supervisor from various university and I found my current supervisor whose interest align perfectly with mine. In my email, I gave details of my previous research work and my resume. He replied promptly and we arrange an interview over Skype. In the interview, He grilled me over 1 hours and was satisfied by my answer at the end.
Interview Questions:
Q: Why would you want to come here?
Q: What is the best idea you ever had?
Q: Where do you see your work going in the next 10-20 years?
Q: What are your professional goals?
Q: What is your previous research experience in Robotics?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I heard of an opening so I applied for the job, a few days later I received an email from whoever was in charge of hiring stating that they had found my application interesting and that they would have liked to see me for an interview so we scheduled a time for me to come in. 
The majority of the questions were behavioral and about being able to work in a team environment as well as the involvement on campus. 
After the interview I believe I heard back from them within 2-5 days with an offer.
All the correspondence was via email.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Biology Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not very difficult. They throw one quirky question at you like  "What kind of kitchen utensil would you be?" It was very quick. No more than 30 minutes I would say.
Interview Questions: What kind of kitchen utensil would you be?

title: Senior Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Received a call for a group interview a few days later. Heard back via email about my decision. They may have hired internally or someone else with more experience because they absolutely were thrilled about me, but a few days later informed me they hire someone else.
Interview Questions:
What can you bring to the position?
What are your goals in the near future?
What do you like to do in your spare time?
Give us an example of when you went above and beyond in your previous jobs.
Why do you want to work at UTA?

title: Coordinator I, Spec Pro Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington
Interview Descriptions: All was pretty standard. 20 min phone screen left feeling of unsurety but received call back for face to face. Panel interview followed.
Interview Questions: Honestly there were no questions that were striking.  Everything was very basic and textbook interview style.  Even with the phone interview - it was basicly probing for resume discrepancies against the job role/responsibilities, leaving the face to face more of a triple check and exam of personality/good fit for the team or not.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Each professor is different, but they prefer kids that do a little homework before going to ask for a position. If you're very proactive and responsible or an international student, you will most likely get the job.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to do research?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I met individually with the professor. He asked of my background and interests. After an hour interview I was given a tour of the lab, and met the other students.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was recruited through Annual RA recruitment drive which starts some where in January and actual interviews happen around March. You will need to apply for the position through SNAP Jobs and they usually call any one who has attended the RA Information Session and lived at least a semester in an On-Campus Apartment. I had three rounds of interview, first two were one on two question answer session where they asses your leadership skills. Google Behavioral questions and they give you an idea of the type of questions asked. Last round is group interview where you will be assigned a team of 7 to 10 members and you will need to perform in a team environment. Key to success is being pro active and being engaging in a team.
Interview Questions: They repeatedly ask same question twice in first two rounds so its advisable to be honest.

title: Accountant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email requesting an interview a couple of days later. I was informed where to park and they paid for it (parking isn't free on campus) and directed where to go. The campus is quite large and it was confusing, so I drove around the day before the interview to get my bearings and know where I was to go. The directions were very clear and I was able to easily find the building.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Why do you believe you would be the best fit for this role?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and laid back.
Interview Questions: Any previous experience in tutoring?

title: Computer Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process seemed surprisingly amateurish and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Personal statement was considered and evaluated, undergraduate GPA was considered and evaluated, research experience was considered and evaluated, GRE and TOEFL both count towards selection of the candidate in the program which is usually quite competitive. Therefore, selection is not an easy process.
Interview Questions: GRE proves to be a pain usually

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very comfortable and relaxed. They were interested in why I wanted this position and how I thought I could use my past experience into the new position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next 10 years at the University?

title: Professor and Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions: I gave a presentation to the faculty and was elected based upon my long record with the department and my description of where I thought the department should go.
Interview Questions: The most difficult (and most straight forward question) regarded my vision for the future of the Physics Department.

title: GRA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions: He said all the politically correct things to say and was charming. He is different on the job.
Interview Questions: What if you get a better offer and want to leave? How can you guarantee you will stay?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: I was called in for a for phone interview which lasted for only 10 minutes. I got the offer letter soon.
Interview Questions: Not really, every question was related to what I did and what I will do.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Texas at Arlington (Arlington, TX) in Feb 2008
Interview Descriptions: The Principle Investigator asked me basic questions like why I was interested in the position. She also checked my skills and asked if I would be prepared to work in a field involving biology and chemistry
Interview Questions: Will you be ready to work on a voluntary basis
